Comments: By Krauss-Maffei. Indoor benchtop model. Only 600 mm long track.

Location: MBB's Ottobrunn factory (near Munich), West Germany
Comments: By MBB. First passenger-carrying principle vehicle. 660 m test track. Prinzipfahrzeug=principle [demonstrator] vehicle.

Location: Krauss-Maffei's plant in Munich - Allach, West Germany
Comments: By Krauss-Maffei. 930 m test track which included one curve. Displayed at Paris Expo from 4 June to 9 June 1973.

By Krauss-Maffei. Air-cushion vehicle (ACV or hovercraft) propelled by a linear motor. The system was abandoned in 1973 due to the too high noise generation and the too large consumption. Attempts in France (Aérotrain) and in the USA ([1]) led in the following years to similar decisions. 930 m test track.

Location: Southern edge of Erlangen (near Nuremberg), West Germany
Comments: By Siemens and others. Electrodynamic suspension (EDS) (like JR-Maglev). Unmanned. 880 m circular track. Erlangener Erprobungsträger=Erlangen test carrier.

Location: Thyssen Henschel in Kassel, West Germany
Comments: By Thyssen Henschel. First functional longstator vehicle. 100 m guideway. Unmanned.
